data.question: What is the phosphorus analogue of DMF?
data.answer: P,P-Dimethylformylphosphine

data.question: What method was used to synthesize the phosphorus analogue of DMF?
data.answer: A synthetic protocol exploiting the species Ph3GePCO

data.question: What computational study was conducted to explore the structural and electronic differences between the nitrogen and phosphorus congeners?
data.answer: A computational study highlights the similarities and differences between the P- and N-containing molecules.

data.question: Is the barrier to P–C(O) bond rotation in the phosphorus analogue of DMF higher or lower than in DMF?
data.answer: The barrier to P–C(O) bond rotation in the phosphorus analogue of DMF is lower than in DMF.

data.question: What was the isolated yield of compound 3 following distillation?
data.answer: The isolated yield of compound 3 following distillation was calculated to be 50%.

data.question: Does compound 3 exhibit stability to the presence of water in solution?
data.answer: Yes, compound 3 proved to be stable to the presence of water in solution.

data.question: What was the method used to determine the T1 relaxation time of compound 3?
data.answer: The T1 relaxation time of compound 3 was determined via inverse-gated recovery 31P NMR experiments.

data.question: Was the synthesis of compound 3 amenable to scale up?
data.answer: Yes, the synthesis of compound 3 is amenable to scale up.

data.question: What was the major product formed when [K][1] was treated with CH3I in the presence of the fluoride source, [NBu4][Ph3SiF2]?
data.answer: The major product formed was compound 2.

data.question: What was the result of photolysis of compound 3?
data.answer: Photolysis of compound 3 did not lead to clean decarbonylation; instead, multiple unidentified products were formed.

data.question: Is the ground state of the phosphorus analogue of DMF planar?
data.answer: No, the ground state of the phosphorus analogue of DMF is not planar.

data.question: What was the solvent used in the synthesis of [K][1] and [K(18-crown-6)][1]?
data.answer: THF was the solvent used in the synthesis.

data.question: Did the computational study find that the barrier to phosphine inversion in the phosphorus analogue of DMF is lower than typical trialkylphosphines?
data.answer: Yes, the computational study found that the barrier to phosphine inversion in the phosphorus analogue of DMF is relatively low compared to typical trialkylphosphines.

data.question: What was the purpose of using [Na(diox)3.00][PCO] in the synthesis?
data.answer: The purpose of using [Na(diox)3.00][PCO] in the synthesis was not explicitly mentioned in the provided text.

data.question: What was the role of 18-crown-6 in the synthesis of [K][1]?
data.answer: 18-crown-6 was used to quantitatively yield [K(18-crown-6)][1] from THF solutions of [K][1].

data.question: Was the reaction of K­[HBPh3] with Ph3GePCO temperature sensitive?
data.answer: The reaction of K­[HBPh3] with Ph3GePCO was conducted at ambient temperature, indicating it was not particularly temperature sensitive.

data.question: What was the computational method used to explore the forces controlling the P–C bond length in phosphamides?
data.answer: The computational method used was not specified in the provided text.

data.question: Did the synthesis of compound 4 involve a metal-complex formation?
data.answer: Yes, the synthesis of compound 4 involved the formation of a metal-complex.

data.question: What was the observed stability of solutions of compound 3 in THF?
data.answer: Solutions of compound 3 in THF showed no signs of decomposition after weeks in the freezer or after refluxing for 8 hours.

data.question: Was the synthesis of the phosphorus analogue of DMF conducted under an inert atmosphere?
data.answer: Yes, the synthesis was performed under an inert atmosphere of anhydrous N2.
